channel.title: Comments on: Arthur Green at HUC-JIR/New York Graduation
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Charles
item.dc:creator: Charles
item.description:
I was present at the speech as I received a DD, honoris causa at the ceremony. Green's speech was well-received by the rabbis and other Jewish professionals present. My family thought it was too long! But it was really addressed to rabbis.
I found it interesting that David Ellenson mentioned that this was the first honorary degree Art Green has ever received. I actually find that astonishing. I also found it politically interesting that HUC choose to honor him in this way given the challenge of non-denominational seminaries like Hebrew College to HUC and JTS. It's common for HUC and JTS to honor each other's faculty but this is a horse of a different color.
It was also interesting to me that Ellenson called Shelly Zimmerman up to present the master's degree to the student cantor at the shul which Zimmerman serves. I guess he is now rehabilitated.

item.description: I wonder if Green is aware of his repackaging of the tropes of the pastorate and the contemporary relevance of the pastorate post Foucault. Or if its just nice drash.
